The dialog test suites have not been included in the UI test suites for some time.  I added these back while adding new tests.  Some of the new tests are not valid.

Some of the tests provided in the patch for bug #82064 are not valid.
I did not take all of the proposed patches, but did not closely examine the submitted tests to remove the ones that weren't relevant to the fixes that were made.

testTexts could be modified to work, but I don't see the point of testing the dialog text sizes of a fake dialog that is there only to verify that the title image can be set before the dialog is opened.  Removing this test, I should not have committed it in the first place.

testSetTitleImageDisposed feeds a disposed image to the dialog, but the dialog does not check for that, nor do I think it should.  This test passes on windows, but not Mac or Linux.  If a programmer feeds a disposed image to the dialog, the error is very obvious, so I don't think the dialog should mask it. Removing this test too.
*** Bug 137567 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
cc'ing McQ for FYI.  There was no fix done here, just removed some bogus tests.
verified on N20060425-0010 - tests are passing
